wikipedia_page.main: Stephen Holgate (15 December 1971 – 16 November 2021) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1990s and 2000s. He played at representative level for England and Cumbria, and at club level for Hensingham ARLFC (in Hensingham, Whitehaven), Workington Town, Wigan Warriors, Hull Sharks and Halifax in the Super League as a prop, or second-row.Holgate played at second-row for Wigan Warriors in their 1998 Super League Grand Final victory over Leeds Rhinos.He died on 16 November 2021, at the age of 49.
